pullRequest.body:
This adds the (unique) C‚ãÜ-norm on matrices `Matrix n n ùïú` with `IsROrC ùïú` within the scope `Matrix.L2OpNorm`. This norm coincides with the operator norm induced by the ‚Ñì¬≤ norm (i.e., the norm on `Matrix m n ùïú` obtained by pulling back the norm from `EuclideanSpace ùïú n ‚ÜíL[ùïú] EuclideanSpace ùïú m`). Where possible, we state results for rectangular matrices.

---

- [x] depends on: #9468
- [x] depends on: #9471

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9468~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9471~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

> Can you add a comment in `Analysis/Matrix` (which contains other norms) that notes that this result exists in another file?

Can you do this?

In `Analysis/Matrix` we also have:
```lean
@[simp]
theorem linfty_op_nnnorm_col (v : m ‚Üí Œ±) : ‚Äñcol v‚Äñ‚Çä = ‚Äñv‚Äñ‚Çä := by

@[simp]
theorem linfty_op_norm_col (v : m ‚Üí Œ±) : ‚Äñcol v‚Äñ = ‚Äñv‚Äñ :=

@[simp]
theorem linfty_op_nnnorm_row (v : n ‚Üí Œ±) : ‚Äñrow v‚Äñ‚Çä = ‚àë i, ‚Äñv i‚Äñ‚Çä :=

@[simp]
theorem linfty_op_norm_row (v : n ‚Üí Œ±) : ‚Äñrow v‚Äñ = ‚àë i, ‚Äñv i‚Äñ :=

@[simp]
theorem linfty_op_nnnorm_diagonal [DecidableEq m] (v : m ‚Üí Œ±) : ‚Äñdiagonal v‚Äñ‚Çä = ‚Äñv‚Äñ‚Çä :=

@[simp]
theorem linfty_op_norm_diagonal [DecidableEq m] (v : m ‚Üí Œ±) : ‚Äñdiagonal v‚Äñ = ‚Äñv‚Äñ :=
```
Are any of these lemmas trivially true/stateable for the C-* norm? (perhaps with `WithLp.equiv` on the RHS)
Only the diagonal one, but I'm not sure we have the machinery to prove it easily at the moment.
I left a TODO for the diagonal result.
I guess there are versions of `row` and `col` which should hold too. Earlier I took your question too literally. But let's just leave it be for now.

:v: j-loreaux can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Note: The C‚ãÜ-property actually holds for rectangular matrices too, but we're not including it here for now because we don't have the corresponding statement for continuous linear maps (i.e., between different spaces). In other words, it is possible to show, but we don't yet have it, that for `A : E ‚ÜíL[ùïú] F`,

#9569 does this generalization, though indeed it doesn't give us access to any of the other CstarRing results, like `norm_star`.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7462548300/job/20305103732)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7462548300/job/20305103984)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7462548300/job/20305103084)
Can you add a comment in `Analysis/Matrix` (which contains other norms) that notes that this result exists in another file?

Thanks

bors d+

I think CI wants you to use `WithLp.equiv` instead of `EuclideanSpace.equiv` in lemma statements (I agree with it)

```suggestion
/-- The natural star algebra equivalence between matrices and continuous linear endomoporphisms
of Euclidean space induced by the orthonormal basis `EuclideanSpace.basisFun`.

This is a more-bundled version of `Matrix.toEuclideanLin`, for the special case of square matrices. -/
```
Which of course raises the fact that we should probably have a version of this for rectangular matrices.

I don't think we actually want a version of this for rectangular matrices, at least not as a separate `def`. That's because for rectangular matrices, using orthonormal bases doesn't really buy you any extra structure, at least not in the form of bundled maps. The best you can do is still `‚âÉ‚Çó[ùïú]`, at which point you can simply write:
```lean
(Matrix.toEuclideanLin.trans LinearMap.toContinuousLinearMap : Matrix m n ùïú ‚âÉ‚Çó[ùïú] (EuclideanSpace ùïú n ‚ÜíL[ùïú] EuclideanSpace ùïú m))
```
So it's just `LinearEquiv.trans` of two existing equivalences.
It's true more generally in TVS, where `LinearMap.toContinuousLinearMap` isn't available; so I still think we should have it.
That just means we need to generalize `LinearMap.toContinuousLinearMap`?

@eric-wieser now I'm really confused because I just looked at [LinearMap.toContinuousLinearMap](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Module/FiniteDimension.html#LinearMap.toContinuousLinearMap) and found that it already holds in a TVS. So what are you arguing for here?

Sorry, I must have mis-remembered the generality of `LinearMap.toContinuousLinearMap`; indeed, my suggestion would be redundant here. Maybe there's some extra generality to eek out for `WithLp` over rings, but that's out of scope here.
Can you still update the docstring to reference `Matrix.toEuclideanLin` as I suggest above? Adding a lemma making the link explicit would also be good.
done and done
Does this generalize to rectangular matrices too?
yes, I have now rewritten to generalize everything to rectangular matrices that can be so generalized.
It looks like you haven't pushed?
Indeed, I meant to finish up, but got distracted.

Please add some `simp` lemmas along the lines of

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/b180173c90858e2031655e09a7165dbf1048324a/Mathlib/Analysis/InnerProductSpace/PiL2.lean#L1018-L1029
Can you add the `nnnorm` version too?
Can you prove `norm_mul` for rectangular matrices like we do for the other matrix norms?

```suggestion
/-- The linear map associated to the conjugate transpose of a matrix corresponding to two
```

```suggestion
lemma l2_op_nnnorm_mulVec (A : Matrix m n ùïú) (x : EuclideanSpace ùïú n) :
```
to match the other three lemmas
Can you hoist `{l : Type*}` to wherever `m` and `n` are declared, to ensure the arguments end up adjacent?

A brief comparison would be good here, perhaps:
```suggestion
/-- This is the same as `Matrix.l2_op_norm_def`, but with a more bundled RHS for square matrices. -/
lemma cstar_norm_def (A : Matrix n n ùïú) : ‚ÄñA‚Äñ = ‚ÄñtoEuclideanClm (n := n) (ùïú := ùïú) A‚Äñ := rfl

/-- This is the same as `Matrix.l2_op_nnnorm_def`, but with a more bundled RHS for square matrices. -/
lemma cstar_nnnorm_def (A : Matrix n n ùïú) : ‚ÄñA‚Äñ‚Çä = ‚ÄñtoEuclideanClm (n := n) (ùïú := ùïú) A‚Äñ‚Çä := rfl
```
Is `NormOneClass` true too? Or is it automatic from `CstarRing`?
Should be automatic with `Nontrivial (Matrix n n ùïú)`, which holds whenever `n` is nonempty.

In the other file we call the analogous construction `linftyOpNormedRing`. I don't mind leaving the renaming of the old defs to a follow-up if you prefer these names, but we should decide which ones we want now
I can switch them here to `instL2OpNormed...`

nit: weird line wrapping
```suggestion
lemma l2_op_nnnorm_mul (A : Matrix m n ùïú) (B : Matrix n l ùïú) : ‚ÄñA * B‚Äñ‚Çä ‚â§ ‚ÄñA‚Äñ‚Çä * ‚ÄñB‚Äñ‚Çä :=
```
Another good TODO would be the one in your PR description, or perhaps the simpler `‚ÄñA·¥¥‚Äñ = ‚ÄñA‚Äñ`.
Can you add the `nnnorm` version too?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: provide the ‚Ñì¬≤ operator norm on matrices
